meanings.sent1: The unarched bridge looked very flat.
meanings.sent2: The doorway was unarched, unlike the others in the castle.
meanings.sent3: The unarched cake was accidentally sat on, making it even flatter.
meanings.sent4: Her unarched response to the joke fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The unarched roof of the house made it stand out in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To straighten or flatten out without a curve
meanings.sent1: She unarched the paper that had been rolled up for too long.
meanings.sent2: The tailor had to unarch the fabric before cutting it.
meanings.sent3: He unarched his back after sitting hunched over for hours.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to unarch reality with his mind-bending tricks.
meanings.sent5: The yoga instructor taught her students how to unarch their posture for better alignment.
